attachments.title: Single Covid vaccine dose in Israel 'less effective than we thought'
attachments.text: Surge in infections dampens optimism over country’s advanced immunisation programme
attachments.fallback: the Guardian: Single Covid vaccine dose in Israel 'less effective than we thought'

attachments.title: Israel’s virus czar says 1st dose less effective than Pfizer indicated — report
attachments.text: Nachman Ash reportedly says it's not certain vaccines can protect against mutated coronavirus strains; 12,400 Israelis were infected with virus after receiving 1st shot
attachments.fallback: Israel’s virus czar says 1st dose less effective than Pfizer indicated — report

text: It was never stated that the first dose alone was reasonably effective, no? The only time I heard about that was from Trump.

elements.text: It was never stated that the first dose alone was reasonably effective, no? The only time I heard about that was from Trump.

text: it is supposed to give _some_ protection

`ϵ > 0` is some… just because it is positive, it means is effectively _some_. Just that the government had a prior that it was somewhat effective might indicate that the public thought so and lower their guard which could have resulted in lower social distancing and higher overall risk.

elements.text: is some… just because it is positive, it means is effectively

. Just that the government had a prior that it was somewhat effective might indicate that the public thought so and lower their guard which could have resulted in lower social distancing and higher overall risk.

text: well, apparently Pfizer gave some numbers which didn't match reality

elements.text: well, apparently Pfizer gave some numbers which didn't match reality

text: > Pfizer says its vaccine, produced with BioNTech, is around 52% effective after the first dose, and increases to about 95% a number of days after the second dose.

elements.text: Pfizer says its vaccine, produced with BioNTech, is around 52% effective after the first dose, and increases to about 95% a number of days after the second dose.

text: It still quite a gap from 1/2 vs 19/20. I would imagine many of those people are getting infected shortly after receiving it before it can actually work and generate the response that can then give the 50% effectiveness. If people get infected before that happens they got infected with a well below 50% effectiveness which should be there around two weeks after the first shot.
